properties.name: Baltimore City Hall - KANN Partners is providing historic preservation and planning services for the Baltimore City Hall.
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners 100 N. Holliday Street Baltimore, Maryland 21202The work of renowned Baltimore architect, George Frederick, the c. 1876 Baltimore City Hall is one of the oldest structures still in continuous use in Baltimore. KANN Partners work involves structural and materials surveys and assessments. Recently, continuing efforts for Baltimore City on the City Hall include masonry restoration and development of a master plan for restorations of the structure.

properties.name: Clifton Mansion: Restoration planning and adaptive re-use of an historic Baltimore home.
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners    Built in 1790 by Henry Thompson and purchased in 1841 by Johns Hopkins, today this Italianate villa sits in Baltimore\'s Clifton Park Golf Course. KANN Partners worked with the Friends of Clifton Mansion and Civic Works (who now calls the mansion home) to assess and develop an Historic Structures report and master plan for further site planning, programming, restoration, and interior design.

properties.name: Eastern High School Adaptive Re-use: This Johns Hopkins University and Hospital project involved the adaptive re-use of an historic high school.
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners  The former Eastern High School (c.1936) is located on a prominent site off of 33rd Street in Baltimore. The project, developed by Johns Hopkins Real Estate, under the direction of Johns Hopkins University and Johns Hopkins Hospital, entailed the restoration, adaptive re-use, and expansion of this former City public school facility. With over 200,000 SF of space, the building was redeveloped to accommodate three uses; a high school for Kennedy Krieger Institute, general offices for the University, and incubator space for start-up companies.

properties.name: Health Care for the Homeless: This sustainable structure designed by KANN Partners is currently under construction.
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners  The new home for Health Care for the Homeless is at the corner of Fallsway and Hillen Street in the Old Town neighborhood in Baltimore City. Full architectural and interior design services are being provided.

properties.name: Johns Hopkins Hospital: Historic structures report, construction documentation, and historic restoration.
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners

properties.name: KANN Parters Office
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners 33 South Gay Street, Baltimore, MD 21202

properties.name: Mount Vernon Place United Methodist Church: Historic structure report and master planning project.
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners    Located at the heart of the cultural district in Baltimore, this circa 1873 church was the subject of an Historic Structures Report prepared by KANN Partners for the Congregation. The report included master planning, prioritization, phasing, and cost estimates and has provided support for several subsequent restoration programs.

properties.name: Patterson Park Pagoda: Historic preservation of an historic landmark.
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners

properties.name: Professional Arts Building: Historically-sensitive, adaptive re-use project.
properties.description: Posted by Kannpartners     101 West Read Street 21201This KANN Partners project in the historic Mount Vernon District in Baltimore entailed converting an 8-story plus basement office building into 96 apartments with common areas that include a fitness center and community room. State and Federal Historic Tax Credits were awarded and all adaptive re-use design elements respected the historically significant architectural features, including many of the unique office building interior doors, brass mail stations, and other features. Ground floor was redesigned to incorporate retail spaces.
